snippet: As a new flash point in the abortion debate focuses on regulating clinics, Maryland’s stricter oversight, spurred by the troubled practice of one doctor, has won rare praise.
abstract: Maryland's sharply tightened oversight of abortion clinics is winning rare bipartisan praise, as new flash point in abortion debate focuses on regulating clinics; new state rules were negotiated not by politicians, but by health officials with goal to make abortions as safe as possible, and may offer different path from other states' regulations.

byline.contributor: Theo Emery contributed reporting from Baltimore, and Alain Delaquérière from New York.

lead_paragraph: As a new flash point in the abortion debate focuses on regulating clinics, Maryland’s stricter oversight, spurred by the troubled practice of one doctor, has won rare praise.

headline.main: Maryland’s Path to an Accord in Abortion Fight
headline.print_headline: Maryland’s Path to an Accord in Abortion Fight
